metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: SVG Transformations
SVG Transformations
SVG elements can be manipulated using transform functions.
content.html: SVG elements can be manipulated using transform functions.

content.text: The transform attribute can be used with any SVG element.
content.html: The transform attribute can be used with any SVG element.

content.text: The transform attribute defines a list of transform functions that can be applied to an element and the element's children:
content.html: The transform attribute defines a list of transform functions that can be applied to an element and the element's children:

content.text: Translate() Function
The translate() function is used to move an object by x and y .
content.html: The translate() function is used to move an object by x and y.

content.text: Assume one object is placed with x="5" and y="5". Then another object contains transform="translate(50 0)", this means that the other object will be placed at x-position 55 (5 + 50) and at y-position 5 (5 + 0).
content.html: Assume one object is placed with x="5" and y="5". Then another object contains transform="translate(50 0)", this means that the other object will be placed at x-position 55 (5 + 50) and at y-position 5 (5 + 0).

content.text: Let's look at some examples:
content.html: Let's look at some examples:

content.text: In this example, the red rectangle is translated/moved to the point (55,5) instead of (5,5):
content.html: In this example, the red rectangle is translated/moved to the point (55,5) instead of (5,5):

content.text: Here is the SVG code:
content.html: Here is the SVG code:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<rect x="5" y="5" width="40" height="40" fill="red" 
  transform="translate(50 0)" />

x="5" y="5" width="40" height="40" fill="red" 
  transform="translate(50 0)" /

content.code:
<svg width="200" height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <rect 
x="5" y="5" width="40" height="40" fill="blue" />
  <rect x="5" y="5" width="40" height="40" fill="red" 
transform="translate(50 0)" />
</svg>

syntax_highlighting.text:
<rect x="5" y="5" width="40" height="40" fill="red" 
  transform="translate(50 0)" />

x="5" y="5" width="40" height="40" fill="red" 
  transform="translate(50 0)" /

</svg>

  transform="translate(50 0)" /

content.text: In this example, the red rectangle is translated/moved to the point (5,55) instead of (5,5):
content.html: In this example, the red rectangle is translated/moved to the point (5,55) instead of (5,5):

content.text: Scale() Function
The scale() function is used to scale an object by x and y . If y is not provided, it is set to be equal to x .
content.html: The scale() function is used to scale an object by x and y. If y is not provided, it is set to be equal to x.

content.text: The scale() function is used to change the size of an object. It takes two numbers: the x scale factor and the y scale factor. The x and y scale factors are taken as the ratio of the transformed dimension to the original. For example, 0.5 shrinks the object by 50%.
content.html: The scale() function is used to change the size of an object. It takes two numbers: the x scale factor and the y scale factor. The x and y scale factors are taken as the ratio of the transformed dimension to the original. For example, 0.5 shrinks the object by 50%.

content.text: In this example, the red circle is scaled to twice the size with the scale() function:
content.html: In this example, the red circle is scaled to twice the size with the scale() function:

content.text: Here is the SVG code:
content.html: Here is the SVG code:

content.code:
<svg width="200" height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <circle cx="25" cy="25" r="20" fill="yellow" />
  <circle cx="50" 
cy="25" r="20" fill="red" transform="scale(2)" />
</svg>
content.code_html:
<svg width="200" height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <circle cx="25" cy="25" r="20" fill="yellow" />
  <circle cx="50" cy="25" r="20" fill="red" transform="scale(2)" />
</svg>

content.text: In this example, the red circle is scaled vertically to twice the size with the scale() function:
content.html: In this example, the red circle is scaled vertically to twice the size with the scale() function:

content.text: Here is the SVG code:
content.html: Here is the SVG code:

content.code:
<svg width="200" height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  
<circle cx="25" cy="25" r="20" fill="yellow" />
  <circle cx="70" 
cy="25" r="20" fill="red" transform="scale(1,2)" />
</svg>
content.code_html:
<svg width="200" height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <circle cx="25" cy="25" r="20" fill="yellow" />
  <circle cx="70" cy="25" r="20" fill="red" transform="scale(1,2)" />
</svg>

content.text: In this example, the red circle is scaled horizontally to twice the size with the scale() function:
content.html: In this example, the red circle is scaled horizontally to twice the size with the scale() function:

content.text: Here is the SVG code:
content.html: Here is the SVG code:

content.code:

  <circle cx="50" 
cy="25" r="20" fill="red" transform="scale(2,1)" />
</svg>
content.code_html:

  <circle cx="50" cy="25" r="20" fill="red" transform="scale(2,1)" />
</svg>

content.text: Rotate() Function
The rotate() function is used to rotate an object by a degree .
content.html: The rotate() function is used to rotate an object by a degree.

content.text: In this example, the blue rectangle is rotated with 45 degrees:
content.html: In this example, the blue rectangle is rotated with 45 degrees:

content.text: Here is the SVG code:
content.html: Here is the SVG code:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<rect x="50" y="5" width="40" height="40" fill="blue" transform="rotate(45)" 
  />

x="50" y="5" width="40" height="40" fill="blue" transform="rotate(45)" 
  /

/>
</svg>

content.text: SkewX() Function
The skewX() function is used to skew an object along the x axis by a degree .
content.html: The skewX() function is used to skew an object along the x axis by a degree.

content.text: In this example, the blue rectangle is skewed along the x axis by 30 degrees:
content.html: In this example, the blue rectangle is skewed along the x axis by 30 degrees:

content.text: Here is the SVG code:
content.html: Here is the SVG code:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<rect x="5" y="5" width="40" height="40" fill="blue" 
  transform="skewX(30)" 
  />

x="5" y="5" width="40" height="40" fill="blue" 
  transform="skewX(30)" 
  /

content.code:
<svg width="200" height="50" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">

transform="skewX(30)"
/>
</svg>
